required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Deep Venous Thrombus Characteristics and Venous Dynamics With Subsequent Thrombus Resolution and Post-thrombotic Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: The Relationship Between Deep Venous Thrombus Characteristics and Venous Dynamics With Subsequent Thrombus Resolution and Post-thrombotic Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this study is to examine in vivo thrombosis characteristics with ultrasound shear wave elastography (SWE) and determine the relationship with thrombus resolution and postthrombotic syndrome (PTS) in patients with acute proximal Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT).

primary_outcome.description: Ultrasound images of lower extremity DVTs comparing the initial diagnostic image of thrombus to a subsequent study performed after 3 months of anticoagulation.The lower extremity venous system is divided into 12 segments. Each vein segment will be analyzed on initial ultrasound and recorded 0 (no DVT), 1 (non-occlusive DVT), or 2 (occlusive DVT). The follow up ultrasound will be analyzed per vein segment and recorded as no residual thrombus, minimal chronic post-thrombotic changes, > 50% resolution, < 50% resolution, near occlusive DVT, no change, and progressive DVT.

secondary_outcome.description: Measured using the Villalta Score. Scale 0-33 with higher values indicating more severe symptoms.
Measured using The Venous Insufficiency Epidemiological and Economic Study (VEINES) QOL survey. Scores range from 0-100 with higher scores indicating better quality of life.

other_outcome.time_frame: 3 and 12 months after diagnosis of DVT
other_outcome.description: Measured using the Villalta Score. Scale 0-33 with higher values indicating more severe symptoms.

other_outcome.time_frame: 3 and 12 months after diagnosis of DVT
other_outcome.description: Measured using The Venous Insufficiency Epidemiological and Economic Study (VEINES) QOL survey. Scores range from 0-100 with higher scores indicating better quality of life.

Measured quantitatively by outflow parameters on air plethysmography with expelled volume measured at 1 second x 60 sec (ml/100ml/minute), expelled volume after 4 seconds, and maximum volume expelled.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with acute, proximal DVT initiating anticoagulation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of acute, proximal (popliteal and above) DVT with or without Pulmonary Embolism within 72 hours
- â‰¥18 Years Old
Exclusion Criteria
- prior episode of DVT
- contraindication to standard therapeutic anticoagulation
